reviews.text: This hotel is very nice. I think it was just built in early 2010. Staff was very nice & professional, will definately stay here again when I am in the area~
reviews.title: Great place, will return!

reviews.text: Spent one night here with a friend while visiting other friends in the area. Front service desk was friendly and efficient, everyone we encountered that worked here was pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Good choice and stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was pretty nice, we had 2 queen beds and they were very comfy. Good sheets, plenty of pillows, big comforter. It was also very quiet and I don't know if there was anyone next to us, we didn't hear a thing. Lots of fluffly white towels and one of the only disappointments was the lack of fan in the bathroom. Why? After showering - we had to use the mirrored closet door to get ready - too steamy to see in the bathroom. Also, no place besides the closet to put clothing, not that we had a lot, but the bookcase used for the TV stand could use a few baskets or something to make it usable.
reviews.title: OK.

reviews.text: We lounged by the pool for a while. Plenty of big pool towels and a little crowded for a Saturday afternoon, but everyone managed to have a seat and enjoy the indoor pool. Nice temperature and a great way to kill a few hours.
reviews.title: Surprised!

reviews.text: Everything was clean, the pool was clear, the people were nice. We did not take advantage of the breakfast (we met friends for brunch at Maxine's on Main), but it looked pretty decent. On a Sunday morning they had eggs, bisquits and sausage gravy, oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, juice, cereal and you could make your own belgian waffles.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, excellent stay!
Better than a Weekend in Austin
